response.answer_text: We know that it is illegal for the government to spy on U.S. citizens in the U.S. without court permission granted on probable cause to suspect that the surveillance would produce useful evidence. We also know that it collects a substantial amount of meta-data on telephone communications, again when there is suspicion of illegal activity. This is done with the cooperation of service providers. There is also considerable monitoring of international communications under FISA authorization.

Government surveillance is an umbrella term used to refer to the actions and ways through which government keeps an eye on all our activities. Government surveillance involves keeping track of people's travelling, banking transactions,call history (rare) etc. Generally surveillance is done to prevent any anti- social and illegal events from happening e.g terrorist activities. To track the person may involve in these acts. Sometimes it is also done to ensure that the benefits intended for people is reaching to them through public authorities. However, government surveillance may result in violating the privacy of citizens. That is why it is always expected to be minimal.
